metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7099 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 is affected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows is affected. iTunes before 12.7 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8
